data.title: Right Now - Under Construction
data.text: The Nicollet Mall, a main mostly pedestrian area in downtown Minneapolis,  is being updated and redesigned.  For 2016 it is not worth seeing as it is under construction.  I am not sure when it will be finished.  You can still shop the stores and restaurants, but the Mall itself is not worth a visit at this time.

data.title: Walked this way
data.text: Came through here on the way to the Mall. The street is a nice stretch of Minneapolis near the shopping mall.

data.title: The best street in Minneapolis
data.text: Nicollet Avenue has everything you could want - restaurants, pubs... even Target! It's a must for any Minneapolis visitor. Even if you don't intend to, you'll probably end up there anyway.

data.title: City not safe at night
data.text: Criminals run rampant at night the cops are not allowed to stop them because of political correctness is very liberal city if you go .go during the day at least you have a fighting chance

data.title: They took Mary Tyler-Moore away!!!
data.text: Nicollet looks like it will be a fun place to shop and eat after they are finished with the construction.  I really wanted to throw my hat up in the air and have my picture taken while doing that....but they must have removed her during the construction..If we are ever back, I'll try finding her again!

data.title: Construction
data.text: Lots of construction around, so it probably detracted from the beauty it would otherwise possess. The area is busy and very energetic, there are some shops, and lots of restaurants. I am not sure that it is any more special than any other downtown Mpls street.

data.title: Not bad
data.text: There's some good restraunts,typical stores.  There's something lot of construction going on and the Mary Tyler Moore statue has been removed to accommodate the constriction, but you can see some of the buildings from the show.

data.title: Hurry before its gone! Nicollet Mall gets makeover.
data.text:
Ill break this into 3 areas; The Mall, Eat Street, and far South Minneapolis. 
1. The Mall is downtown and a nice walk with the usual downtown stores. Average
2. Eat Street is the area south of 18th and has quite a few restaurants that are worth the trip
3. Far South (south of 62nd) dont bother

data.title: Quick stop, worth the picture
data.text: I drove into downtown because there were nearly a dozen things I wanted to see. I don't know if I would make a trip specifically for the statue or not, maybe without my kids, but definitely walk over there to snap a picture if you're in the area.

data.title: Undergoing renovations
data.text: Undergoing renovations with some street parking and expensive parking in a structure.  See the Mary Tyler Moore tribute statue not far from Nicollete Ave and several other buildings featured in the sitcom.  Nice peaceful end, touristy, shopping and restaurants.  Have fun!

data.title: It's Happening in Downtown Minneapolis
data.text: Minneapolis at it's best -- sights and sounds of a city in action!!  It's a fun place to gather and share with guests, free concerts, shopping, new library, farmer's market, businesses, light rail and bus accessible.

data.title: Why it's an attraction ?
data.text: Main pedestrian street always overloaded with bus, police car and taxi that have few restaurant patio... But that's it, almost no shops...

data.title: Go during the day...
data.text: This area is a little dated, but still a pretty cool place for shops and eateries. If you're downtown and nearby, it is worth the stroll. A friend and I strolled through a few blocks on the way to and from Target Field. I would advise going during the day because you'll have more shopping/restaurant options and the area appeared a little more unsafe at night. If you're a fan of the Mary Tyler Moore Show, the Mary statue at the corner of Nicollet and 7th is a must-see!

data.title: Nice walk during the day
data.text: Heart of downtown Minneapolis, Nicolett Avenue was a nice street to walk down and take in a bit of this city. Gives you access to some of the stores located down this street (Marshall's, Macy's, Gavidae Common, Target, Off Saks Fifth) and also has many pubs and cafe's along this stretch. Little fountains/sculptures/green spaces along the way really adds character and I found it very clean with no graffiti. Would not walk down this street alone in the evening as seems to attract a different crowd at night.

data.title: It was OK
data.text: I was a little disappointed.  Thought there would be a lot more specialty stores instead of stores you can shop at Mall of America.  They did have many restaurants but personally preferred the ones on 1st Ave.  It is a must see just to say you've been there, but I personally found it a little dissapointing.

data.title: Rough Crowd
data.text: Did not feel safe on a summer Sunday evening.  Surprised to see such a rough crowd.  Homeless man shaving in Barnes & Noble bathroom when my son and husband when in.

data.title: Great place to visit for a few hours.
data.text: There is not much difference between this and the Nicollet Mall review. There are some great places to eat but you will need to call ahead if you have a large group.

data.title: Great Summer Time Experience...
data.text:
Stroll down the mall...do a little shopping...have a drink at a patio bar/restaurant...catch a performance at the Dakota or Orchestra Hall or walk a couple blocks for a Twins game.  No better way to celebrate summer in the city.

The Mall is aging but better than ever.  I am excited to see if they will really put the money in to upgrade/update this great place.

data.title: Bad and good depending on where you are
data.text: Some parts are a little creepy but going toward downtown it gets better. Food and shopping throughout but more toward downtown and in downtown.

data.title: Fun in the summer
data.text: Nicollet Avenue is fun to stroll up and down during the evenings. There's plenty of restaurants and bars to stop at along the way. If you're into food or into drinking then there'll be something there for you - from super high end ($$$) to low end ($).
